page.title: 17BAYSTON HILL INTERVIEW
page.content: This lady that I interviewed was four when she came to Bayston Hill.When the children came home from school which was by the church on the common they had to get the water from the well.Because there was no water out of a tap.There were two lodges on the way to Lythwood Hall but now one of the lodges has been knocked down.The land by the lodges was all meadow.Just ahead of the meadows was a forest which joined up with Parrs wood,the wood by the football pitch and the wood by Lythwood hall.The main bit of the village was by the Common and some of the original houses are still there.The village shop was next to the Fox pub.For transport you either had to walk or later on some people had bikes.This lady likes the development of the village because she has got a job at the Shropshire Oven.
